titlestmt.author: Archives Staff; updated by Karen Spilman

did.repository: University of Minnesota Libraries. University of Minnesota Archives [uarc]
did.abstract: This collection contains field notebooks complete by personnel of the Minnesota Geological Survey, and its predecessor, the Minnesota Geological and Natural History Survey.

accessrestrict.head: Use of Materials
accessrestrict.p: Items in this collection do not circulate and may be used in-house only.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Researchers may quote from the collection under the fair use provision of the copyright law (Title 17, U.S. Code). Requests to publish should be arranged with the University of Minnesota Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Minnesota Geological Survey field notebooks, University Archives, University of Minnesota, Twin Cities.

acqinfo.head: Source of acquisition
acqinfo.p: Notebooks housed in the first three boxes of the collection were deposited in the University of Minnesota Archives by the Geology Department; the remaining notebooks were deposited by the Minnesota Geological Survey in July 2007.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Many of the notebooks were assigned an arbitrary number by the Minnesota Geological Survey for filing and tracking purposes. Not all notebooks were numbered and many numbers were not used. For ease of use, field notebooks are arranged alphabetically by “author.” For reference purposes, the numerical list maintained by MGS is in Box 4, folder 1.

Removed from the collection were several notebooks by Alexander Winchell (brother of Newton H. Winchell) and his colleagues at the Michigan Geological Survey. However, Winchell’s field notes on work done in Minnesota for MGNHS were retained. Several other notebooks which seemed of little value as they were undated and unrecorded were put aside for disposal.

Separate collections were created for sets of field notes maintained by Christopher Hall (collection 731) and Newton Horace Winchell (collection 981). They include both private work, work done for the U.S. Geological Survey as well as work done for MGNHS.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of field notebooks created by the personnel of Minnesota Geological Survey (MGS), and its predecessor, the Minnesota Geological and Natural History Survey (MGNHS). The field notebooks contain basic data used in many of the survey’s annual reports and bulletins.

Of special note are the field notes kept by Ulysses S. Grant who did most of his work in Northern Minnesota on the North Shore. His notes are among the most complete and include a study of the gold mining along Rainy Lake (Box 1, folders 6-7; Box 2, folders 8-9). Others, while more sketchy, contain a great deal of information about Minnesota geology and natural history.
Some of the volumes are in poor condition, with broken bindings and loose pages.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Minnesota Geological and Natural History Survey (MGNHS) was established on 1 March 1872 by an act of the legislature and the University of Minnesota was placed in charge of conducting the survey. Newton H. Winchell was brought to the University in 1872 to direct the survey. Winchell resigned in 1900 causing the survey to be abandoned until 1911 when William H. Emmons was hired to be the new head of the Geology department and director of the survey, renamed the Minnesota Geological Survey (MGS).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials in University Archives
relatedmaterial.p: Minnesota Geological and Natural History Survey records

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the catalog of the University of Minnesota Libraries. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons or places should search the catalog using these headings.
controlaccess.corpname: Geological and Natural History Survey of Minnesota.
controlaccess.subject: Botany--Minnesota.
Geology--Minnesota.
